page.title: 08THE VILLAGE HALL,CRADLEY.
page.content: Cradley Village Hall was built in the 14th century.The hall was a black and white building.The timber is oak and some of the original wood is there.The walls were made out of wattle and daub. At first it is thought that it was a priest's house or where the visiting priests would stay.In 1667 a man called James Turner left Â£20 a year for ever to turn it into a free school for boys.The headmaster lived above the school.In 1909 the girls had a school down the lane and the boys moved down and stayed there.In the second world war the hall became a food store.Later,school meals were served there.They had good meals to eat and were looked after well.The Village Hall is now used for meetings,concerts,Women's Institute and play group.
